org.eng.aisp.feature.processor.vector

Class DeltaFeatureProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.processor.GenericCachingDataProcessor
      • org.eng.aisp.feature.processor.AbstractCachingMultiFeatureProcessor<double[]>
        • org.eng.aisp.feature.processor.vector.AbstractVectorMappingFeatureProcessor
          • org.eng.aisp.feature.processor.vector.DeltaFeatureProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IFeatureProcessor<double[]>

    public class DeltaFeatureProcessor
extends AbstractVectorMappingFeatureProcessor
implements IFeatureProcessor<double[]>
    Computes the delta (defined as the standard way in speech processing) of features with options to normalize and scale features.

    See MatrixUtil#columnDelta(double[][], int) and http://practicalcryptography.com/miscellaneous/machine-learning/guide-mel-iifrequency-cepstral-coefficients-mfccs/#deltas-and-delta-deltas

    Author:
    wangshiq
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeltaFeatureProcessor

        public DeltaFeatureProcessor(int halfWindowSize,
                             double[] differenceWeights,
                             DeltaFeatureProcessor.ScaleMethod scaleMethod,
                             boolean zeroMean)
        Define the features produced including the number of differences and whether and how normalization is done on a per delta basis. Any number of differences may be computed, including 0, with all feature deltas for a given feature concatenated into a single vector. The resulting feature for an input of N x M will be N x k*M, where k is the number of deltas (including 0 if requested) requested. The number of differences and which ones to output is controlled by the differenceWeights parameter and normalization by #scaleMethod and #zeroMean. Normalization is done across the whole matrix of features provided to #map(IFeature[], IFeature[]) or deltas of those features, separately. The values are normalized by the following formula:
        • x[i] = (x[i] - offsetAdjust) / scaleFactor;
        Where offsetAdjust is the mean of the x values across the whole matrix if #zeroMean is true, otherwise 0, and scaleFactor is set according to #scaleMethod. Deltas are computed on the original unnormalized values.
        Parameters:
        halfWindowWidth - The defines the window size as 2*halfWidth+1 for delta computation, must be larger than zero.
        differenceWeights - defines a) the number of differences to take and b) the weights applied to each difference. The zero'th element applies to the original feature (i.e. zero order difference). Weights are applied after normalization, if any. If the weight for the Nth difference is 0, then the Nth difference is not included in the output. So for example, to compute the order 1 difference use { 0, 1 }, for the order 2 difference only, use { 0,0,1 } for both the order 1 and 2 differences using { 0, 1, 1 }. To include the original feature data set the first weight to a non-zero value. For example, to get 3 features concatenated into a single feature, set the weights to {1, 1, 1}. And of course you may use different weights other than 1. NOTE:Because of the way deltas are computed, the 1st difference is scaled down by 2 and 2nd difference is scaled down by 8, so that you may want to consider weights of {1, 2, 8}.
        scaleMethod - controls whether or not scaling is done and if so, what scale factor is used.
        • DeltaFeatureProcessor.ScaleMethod.Unscaled no scaling is done and scaleFactor is set to 1.
        • DeltaFeatureProcessor.ScaleMethod.ScaleByStddev then scaling is done by the standard deviation and scaleFactor is set to the standard deviation of the whole matrix.
        • DeltaFeatureProcessor.ScaleMethod.ScaleByRange then scaling is done by range of values and scaleFactor is set to the (max - min) of the whole matrix.
        zeroMean - if true then the offsetAdjustment value in the above formula is set to the mean of the x values across the matrix, otherwise it is set to 0. This setting is independent of the scaling method (so you can zero the mean even if you don't want to scale the data).

    • Method Detail

      • map

        protected double[][] map(IFeature<double[]>[] features,
                         double[][] inputFeatureData)
        Computes and returns the delta features
        Specified by:
        map in class AbstractVectorMappingFeatureProcessor
        Parameters:
        features - array of IFeature
        inputFeatureData - the data extracted from the given features. Should NOT be modified.
        Returns:
        new matrix delta features computed on the input features, possibly including the original features. If there are not enough input features, then we return a 0x0 matrix.
        Throws:
        AISPException
